creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: framed triptych: male and female figure seated on a cushion at C, watching the antics of creatures with human bodies with sea-creature heads: at L, fish with human bodies wrestle, while another figure holds up an object under the spray of a black whale at bottom; near C, a tortoise balances a sake barrel on its leg, while a crab cuts paper decorations; at R, a squid, fish, and other creatures play instruments, and look on
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscriptions, and Seals

Inscribed title:
markings: Publisher\'s seal (rectangular): [Kazusaya Iwazo]; R censor\'s seal: [Kinugasa Fusajiro]; L censor\'s seal: [Hama Yahei]; Artist\'s seal: (Red paulownia)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: Signature: [Playfully painted by Ichiyusai Kuniyoshi] (Ichiyusai Kuniyoshi giga); Inscribed title: [Ryugu asobi sakanagei zukushi (Sea creatures entertain Urashima Taro and Oto Hime at the undersea Dragon Palace)]
title: Sea creatures entertain Urashima Taro and Oto Hime in the Dragon Palace
